multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm experiencing persistent bleeding from my gums following a dental procedure.
Have you noticed any unusual bruising or bleeding from other parts of your body?
Yes, I have a history of easy bruising.
Do you have any known blood disorders or a personal or family history of bleeding problems?
My mother mentioned that my uncle had similar bleeding problems and also experiences easy bruising and joint swelling.
Are you currently on any medications, including over-the-counter drugs or supplements?
No, I'm not taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: von Willebrand Disease

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I had persistent bleeding from my gums during a dental procedure, and I tend to bruise easily.
Have you noticed any unusual bleeding or bruising in the past, prior to this dental procedure?
Yes, I have a history of easy bruising.
Do you have any family history of bleeding disorders?
Yes, my uncle had similar problems with bleeding and easy bruising when he had his wisdom teeth removed.
Have you been previously diagnosed with any medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with any medical conditions and I don't take any medications.
Do your bleeding episodes stop on their own or do you often require medical intervention to control the bleeding?
The bleeding episodes do not stop easily on their own; during my dental procedure, multiple gauze packs were applied but had minimal effect in stopping the bleeding.
Final Diagnosis: von Willebrand Disease

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I had persistent bleeding from the gums after my wisdom teeth were removed and I also have a history of easy bruising.
How long have you been experiencing easy bruising?
I have been experiencing easy bruising for a long time.
Have you had any recent infections or been feeling generally unwell lately?
No, I have not had any recent infections or felt generally unwell lately.
Do you have any family history of bleeding disorders or similar symptoms?
Yes, my mother's brother had similar problems with bleeding when his wisdom teeth were removed, and he also has a history of easy bruising and joint swelling.

No formal diagnosis of a specific bleeding disorder has been made for me or my family members.

Yes, I have had laboratory tests done which included a complete blood count, prothrombin time, partial thromboplastin time, and bleeding time.
Did the results of these tests show any abnormalities?
Yes, the partial thromboplastin time was prolonged at 60 seconds.
Final Diagnosis: Hemophilia A
